references.bibentry: Amre, D. K,, D’Souza, S,, Morgan, K,, Seidman, G,, Lambrette, P,, Grimard, G, …, Seidman, E. G. (2007). Imbalances in dietary consumption of fatty acids, vegetables, and fruits are associated with risk for Crohn’s disease in children. American Journal of Gastroenterology, 102(9), 2016–11. PMID: 17617201

Barnes, E. L,, Nestor, M,, Onyewadume, L,, de Silva, P, &, Korzenik, J. R. (2017). High dietary intake of speciﬁc fatty acids increases risk of flares in patients with ulcerative colitis in remission during treatment with aminosalicylates. Clinical Gastroenterology and Hepatology, 15(9), 1390–1396. PMID: 28110099

Bergeron, F,, Bouin, M,, D’Aoust, L,, Lemoyne, M, &, Presse, N. (2018). Food avoidance in patients with inﬂammatory bowel disease: What, when and who? Clinical Nutrition, 37(3), 884–889. PMID: 28359542
Braun, V, &, Clarke, V. (2006). Using thematic analysis in psychology. Qualitative Research in Psychology, 3(2), 77–101.
Braun, V, &, Clarke, V. (2014). What can “thematic analysis” offer health and wellbeing researchers? International Journal of Qualitative Studies on Health and Well-being, 9, 1–2 article 26152.

Charlebois, A,, Rosenfeld, G, &, Bressler, B. (2016). The impact of dietary interventions on the symptoms of inﬂammatory bowel disease: A systematic review. Critical Reviews in Food Science and Nutrition, 56(8), 1370–1378. PMID: 25569442

Cohen, S. A,, Gold, B. D,, Oliva, S,, Lewis, J,, Stallworth, A,, Koch, B, …, Mason, D. (2014). Clinical and mucosal improvement with specific carbohydrate diet in pediatric Crohn disease. Journal of Pediatric Gastroenterology and Nutrition, 59(4), 516–521.

Cooper, J. M,, Collier, J,, James, V, &, Hawkey, C. J. (2010). Beliefs about personal control and self-management in 30–40 year olds living with inﬂammatory bowel disease: A qualitative study. International Journal of Nursing Studies, 47(12), 1500–1509.

Feagan, B. G,, Sandborn, W. J,, Mittmann, U,, Bar-Meir, S,, D’Haens, G,, Bradette, M, …, Rutgeers, P. (2008). Omega-3 free fatty acids for the maintenance of remission in Crohn disease. JAMA, 299(14), 1690–1697. PMID: 18398081

Fletcher, P. C, &, Schneider, M. A. (2006). Is there any food I can eat? Living with inflammatory bowel disease and/or irritable bowel syndrome. Clinical Nurse Specialist, 20(5), 241–247. PMID: 16980794

Hall, N. J,, Rubin, G. P,, Dougall, A,, Hungin, A. P, &, Neely, J. (2005). The fight for “health-related normality”: A qualitative study of the experiences of individuals living with established inﬂammatory bowel disease (IBD). Journal of Health Psychology, 10(3), 443–455. PMID: 15857873

Holt, D. Q,, Strauss, B. J, &, Moore, G. T. (2017). Patients with inﬂammatory bowel disease and their treating clinicians have different views regarding diet. Journal of Human Nutrition and Dietetics, 30(1), 66–72. PMID: 27412965

Jowett, S. L,, Seal, C. J,, Phillips, E,, Gregory, W,, Barton, J. R, &, Welfare, M. R. (2004). Dietary beliefs of people with ulcerative colitis and their effect on relapse and nutrient intake. Clinical Nutrition, 23(2), 161–170. PMID: 15030955

Kinsey, L, &, Burden, S. (2016). A survey of people with inﬂammatory bowel disease to investigate their views of food and nutritional issues. European Journal of Clinical Nutrition, 70(7), 852–854. PMID: 27117934

Nutrition support for pediatric patients with inflammatory bowel disease: A clinical report of the North American society for pediatric gastroenterology, hepatology and nutrition. Journal of Pediatric Gastroenterology and Nutrition, 39(1), 15–27. PMID: 15187775
Kostic, A. D,, Xavier, R. J, &, Gevers, D. (2014). The microbiome in inﬂammatory bowel disease: Current status and the future ahead. Gastroenterology, 146(6), 1489–1499. PMID: 24560869

Lee, D,, Albenberg, L,, Compher, C,, Baldassano, R,, Piccoli, D,, Lewis, J. D, &, Wu, G. D. (2015). Diet in the pathogenesis and treatment of inﬂammatory bowel diseases. Gastroenterology, 148(6), 1087–1106. PMID: 25597840

Lewis, J. D,, Chen, E. Z,, Baldassano, R. N,, Otley, A. R,, Griffiths, A. M,, Lee, D, …, Bushman, F. D. (2015). Inﬂammation, antibiotics, and diet as environmental stressors of the gut microbiome in pediatric Crohn’s Disease. Cell Host & Microbe, 18(4), 489–500. PMID: 26468751

Nutrition in pediatric inflammatory bowel disease: A position paper on behalf of the porto inflammatory bowel disease group of the European society of pediatric gastroenterology, hepatology and nutrition. Journal of Pediatric Gastroenterology and Nutrition, 66(4), 687–708. PMID: 29570147

Ng, S. C,, Shi, H. Y,, Hamidi, N,, Underwood, F. E,, Tang, W,, Benchimol, E. I, …, Kaplan, G. G. (2017). Worldwide incidence and prevalence of inflammatory bowel disease in the 21st century: A systematic review of population-based studies. Lancet, 390, 2769–2778. PMID: 29050646

Palant, A,, Koschack, J,, Rassmann, S,, Lucius-Hoene, G,, Karaus, M, &, Himmel, W. (2015). “And then you start to loose it because you think about Nutella”: The significance of food for people with inflammatory bowel disease -a qualitative study. BMC Gastroenterology, 15, 93. PMID: 26219642

Prince, A,, Whelan, K,, Moosa, A,, Lomer, M. C, &, Reidlinger, D. P. (2011). Nutritional problems in inflammatory bowel disease: The patient perspective. Journal of Crohn’s and Colitis, 5(5), 443–450.

Richmond, E, &, Rhodes, J. M. (2013). Review article: Evidence-based dietary advice for patients with inﬂammatory bowel disease. Alimentary Pharmacology & Therapeutics, 38(10), 1156–1171. PMID: 24102340

Schneider, M. A,, Jamieson, A, &, Fletcher, P. C. (2009). “One sip won’t do any harm … ”: Temptation among women with inﬂammatory bowel disease/irritable bowel syndrome to engage in negative dietary behaviours, despite the consequences to their health. International Journal of Nursing Practice, 15(2), 80–90. PMID: 19335525
Statistics Canada (2017). Household income in Canada: Key results from the 2016 census. Retrieved from https://www.statcan.gc.ca/daily-quotidien/170913/dq170913a-eng.htm

Suskind, D. L,, Wahbeh, G,, Gregory, N,, Vendettuoli, H, &, Christie, D. (2014). Nutritional therapy in pediatric Crohn disease: The specific carbohydrate diet. Journal of Pediatric Gastroenterology and Nutrition, 58(1), 87–91. PMID: 24048168

Svolos, V,, Gerasimidis, K,, Buchanan, E,, Curtis, L,, Garrick, V,, Hay, J, …, Hansen, R. (2017). Dietary treatment of Crohn’s disease: Perceptions of families with children treated by exclusive enteral nutrition, a questionnaire survey. BMC Gastroenterology, 17, 14. PMID: 28103809

Wahbeh, G. T,, Ward, B. T,, Lee, D. Y,, Giefer, M. J, &, Suskind, D. L. (2017). Lack of mucosal healing from modified specific carbohydrate diet in pediatric patients with Crohn disease. Journal of Pediatric Gastroenterology and Nutrition, 65(3), 289–292. PMID: 28825776
Winglee, K, &, Fodor, A. A. (2015). Intrinsic association between diet and the gut microbiome: Current evidence. Nutrition and Dietary Supplements, 7, 69–76. PMID: 28690398
Zachos, M,, Tondeur, M, &, Griffiths, A. M. (2007). Enteral nutritional therapy for induction of remission in Crohn’s disease. Cochrane Database of Systematic Reviews, 1, CD000542.
Zallot, C,, Quillot, D, &, Chevaux, J. B. (2013). Dietary beliefs and behavior among inflammatory bowel disease patients. Inflammatory Bowel Diseases, 19(1), 66–72. PMID: 22467242
Zutshi, M,, Hull, T. L, &, Hammel, J. (2007). Crohn’s disease: A patient’s perspective. International Journal of Colorectal Disease, 22(12), 1437–1444. PMID: 17665207
